--- Page 161 ---
147
Cardiovascular medicine
Fig 3.44 Severely calciﬁ ed aortic valve.
Reproduced with permission from Hamid Reza Taghipour.
Fig 3.45 This is one of the two main types of 
transcatheter aortic valve implants: animal 
valve leaﬂ ets mounted on metal stents. This ex-
traordinary stucture must be resilient against the 
movement of the heart walls and the powerful ﬂ ow 
of blood; it must avoid obstructing forward ﬂ ow 
of blood whilst providing a near-complete block to 
backﬂ ow; and it has surfaces of foreign material yet 
must avoid triggering clots or allowing microbial 
growth. On top of this, it must be able to fold down 
over a wire to allow safe passage through the ar-
terial tree from the groin to the heart, before being 
opened out by an inﬂ ated balloon.
